clinical_study.brief_title: Development of a Laboratory Test for the Detection of a Fluorescent-labeled Urease Inhibitor Marker Attached to Helicobacter Pylori
clinical_study.official_title: Development of a Laboratory Test for the Detection of a Fluorescent-labeled Urease Inhibitor Marker Attached to Helicobacter Pylori Using Biopsies Taken During Gastroscopy in Patients in Which the Bacterium is Suspected

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare the usual rapid urease test (RUT) to a new florescent-labeled urease inhibitor marker to diagnose Helicobacter Pylori.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of a Fluorescent-labeled Urease Inhibitor Marker to Detect Helicobacter Pylori Infection
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of results of biopsies analyzed with a fluorescent-labeled urease inhibitor marker to detect Helicobacter Pylori infection and results will be compared to standard tests to detect Helicobacter Pylori

arm_group.arm_group_label: Fluorescent-labeled Urease Inhibitor Marker to Detect Helicobacter Pylori
arm_group.description: During gastroscopy additional biopsies are taken in cases where infection with helicobacter pylori is suspected. It will then undergo laboratory analysis with fluorescent-labeled urease inhibitor marker. Results will be compared to standard analysis to determine efficacy.

intervention.intervention_name: Fluorescent-labeled Urease Inhibitor Marker to Detect Helicobacter Pylori
intervention.description: Diagnostic laboratory test for detection of helicobacter pylori
intervention.arm_group_label: Fluorescent-labeled Urease Inhibitor Marker to Detect Helicobacter Pylori

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing gastroendoscopy with suspected Helicobacter Pylori
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with active bleeding
- Patients treated with anti-coagulation medication
